result.execSummary:
All charges against John Allen Barnes III in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Allen Barnes III is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing on June 23, 2022 Court Reporter Ashley Shimek

Prosecuting attorney J. Foss Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John Allen Barnes III in court.  Attorney Michael T Crosby in court for John Allen Barnes III. 
Per the courts they do not find probable cause and case is dismissed without prejudice. 
All bond amount and conditions are released. 
Emailed minute sheet to ADL.

No  contact with L.D.C. or Superior Liquor on Military Avenue or their residence or place of employment.  
Absolute sobriety. 
GPS to remain in place and must maintain 2,000 feet restriction from L.D.C. residence.

Defendant John Allen Barnes III in court.  Attorney Michael T Crosby in court for John Allen Barnes III. 
Attorney C. Saunders appeared, in-person, on behalf of the State.
Court modifies bond - see separate entry for details.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
